text: This is a list of vice presidents of the Constitutional Court () of Austria. The vice president of the Constitutional Court is the principal deputy to the president. He becomes the acting head of the court if the president resigns, dies or is dismissed. == List of officeholders == {| class="wikitable" style="border:#555;"" |- ! class="unsortable" style="width:150px;"| Portrait ! Name ! Took office ! Left office ! Notes |- | | Adolf Menzel | 1919 | 1930 | |- ! colspan=8| Constitutional Court disbanded from 1934 to 1945 |- | | Ludwig Adamovich senior | 1945 | 1946 | |- | | Gustav Zigeuner | 1946 | 1956 | |- | | Karl Wolff | 1958 | 1960 | |- | | Walter Antoniolli | 1957 | 1958 | |- | | Leopold Werner | 1969 | 1975 | |- | | Anton Mahnig | 1961 | 1969 | |- | | Kurt Ringhofer | 1976 | 1993 | |- | | Karl Piska | 1993 | 1998 | |- | 150px | Karl Korinek | 1 January 1999 | 31 December 2002 | |- | 150px | Brigitte Bierlein | 1 January 2003 | 22 February 2018 | |- | 150px | Christoph Grabenwarter | 23 February 2018 | 19 February 2020 | |- |150px |Verena Madner | 24 April 2020 | Present | |} ==See also== * Judiciary of Austria * History of Austria * Politics of Austria * Supreme Court of Justice (Austria) ==External links== * Members of the Constitutional Court == References == Category:Constitutional Court of Austria judges
title: List of vice presidents of the Constitutional Court (Austria)
